meanings.definition: vastiest: superlative form of vast, meaning extremely large or extensive
meanings.sent1: The vastiest ocean stretched out before us, endless and wide.
meanings.sent2: The Sahara Desert is one of the vastiest deserts in the world.
meanings.sent3: The vastiest pizza I've ever seen could feed a whole town!
meanings.sent4: Her collection of books was the vastiest treasure in her eyes.
meanings.sent5: The vastiest mountain peak reached up to touch the sky.

meanings.definition: vastiest: used to compare two or more things in terms of their vastness or size
meanings.sent1: Among the trees, the oak was the vastiest, towering over the rest.
meanings.sent2: In the galaxy, the Milky Way is the vastiest collection of stars.
meanings.sent3: The vastiest cake at the party was gone in minutes, devoured by hungry guests.
meanings.sent4: His dreams were the vastiest, reaching beyond the limits of imagination.
meanings.sent5: The vastiest elephant in the herd trumpeted loudly, asserting its dominance.
